%c[0,150,150,150]Loners, or free stalkers, are unaligned with any of the factions that operate within the Zone.
 
Despite being frequently harassed by mutants and other stalkers, small groups have managed to establish strong trading outposts throughout the Zone.
 
%c[0,255,255,255]Recommended for: new players.
%c[0,150,150,150]Bandits are members of the criminal underworld who came to the Zone for different reasons; to make money by selling artefacts, to hide from the law or even to trade in weapons.

%c[0,150,150,150]Duty is a paramilitary faction at odds with everyone seeking to exploit the Zone and, as Duty sees it, spread its corruption.\n \nThey have long been in fierce conflict with Freedom due to their conflicting ideals.
%c[0,150,150,150]Freedom are anarchists and daredevils who declare themselves to be fighting for free access to the Zone and consequently find themselves in constant conflict with Duty.
%c[0,150,150,150]The Ukrainian government, through its Ministry of Internal Affairs, maintains the Zone's perimeter with internal troops from the State Security Service.

%c[0,150,150,150]The Ecologists are a government-funded body researching the Zone in order to properly harness its potential for the good of mankind.\n \n%c[0,255,255,255]Recommended for: pacifistic players.
%c[0,150,150,150]Mercenaries are experienced fighters from all walks of life who offer their services as hired soldiers, it is unknown who their clients are or why they have interests in the Zone.

%c[0,150,150,150]"The Monolith is light and knowledge, knowledge and light. The time will come - chosen ones will be saved".
 
Monolith are a fanatical religious cult hostile to all but their own.
 
Despite the destruction of the C-Conciousness they have since re-emerged as a resurgent force, retaking many of their former territories.
 
%c[0,255,255,255]Recommended for: advanced players.

%c[0,150,150,150]Clear Sky is an independent scientific and military organisation focused on researching and understanding the Zone.
 
Facing almost complete collapse after a failed and costly assault on Chernobyl NPP, a handful of the few remaining survivors managed to rebuild the faction to its former stature.
 
%c[0,255,255,255]Recommended for: new players.

%c[0,150,150,150]Braaaiiinnnsss!!!
 
Zombified stalkers are mindless husks of their previous selves reduced to their most basic animal-like instincts and will attack almost anything that gets too close.
 
%c[0,255,255,255]Recommended for: advanced players.
%c[0,150,150,150]Choose the start location of your new game.

%c[0,150,150,150]Choose whether you will be accompanied by companions from the very beginning of the game. 
 
%c[200,50,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]After 3 hours of real time, companions will become invulnerable to any type of damage and will be able to exchange items for free. 
%c[200,50,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]Companions who accompany you from the very beginning of the game have these bonuses initially. 
%c[200,50,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]Invulnerability will be indicated by the shield icon located in the upper left corner of the companion's interface. 
%c[200,50,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]You can make your companions vulnerable in your playthrough at any time. 
See "Options" -> "Game" -> "Companions invulnerability"

%c[0,150,150,150]Gameplay difficulty affects player's protection and the accuracy of weapons in general. It applies to the player and other stalkers alike.
 
%c[200,50,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]You can change gameplay difficulty in your playthrough at any time. 
See "Options" -> "Game" -> "Difficulty"

%c[0,150,150,150]Story mode starts the game with the 'Mysteries of the Zone' storyline, and with the goals to disable the Brain Scorcher and Miracle Machine.
 
Elements from previous storylines are borrowed and recreated, so this is not for players who feel that strict story continuity is essential.
 
Only available to Loner, Duty, Freedom, Ecologist, Mercenary and Clear Sky factions.
 
%c[200,200,50,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]Not compatible with Azazel mode. 
 
%c[0,255,255,255]Recommended for: new players.

%c[0,150,150,150]Ironman mode is a feature that will remove your game saves upon death.
 
You are free to make as many saves as you wish but dying will result in the removal of all saves made with this character. 
 
%c[0,255,255,255]Recommended for: advanced players.
%c[0,150,150,150]Hardcore AI Aim is a feature that maximizes AI aim predictability, making it more difficult for the player to dodge hits while moving.

%c[0,150,150,150]Remember Jill Valentine from Resident Evil - there are only hordes of zombies around, ready to tear you to pieces! 
 
Survival mode replaces most spawns with Zombified stalkers and zombies. 
 
See how long you can survive! 
 
%c[200,200,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]If Extended population mode is active, then you will have relatively safe only the first 24 hours, because the spawn activity of the living dead will increase every hour. Use your time wisely!

%c[0,150,150,150]In Azazel mode, death is not the end.
 
Like the demon Azazel you will possess a new body when you die; taking over the form of another random stalker that really exists in the Zone.
 
If you have companions, you will become one of them. This feature compliments Ironman and/or Survival mode very well.
 
%c[200,200,50,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]Not compatible with Story mode.

%c[0,150,150,150]In Campfire save mode, you can't save your progress unless if you're standing nearby campfire. \n \n%c[200,50,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]All hardcore save modes are compatible with each other.

%c[0,150,150,150]Agony mode will prevent you from saving your progress if you're: 
%c[200,200,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]Injured 
%c[200,200,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]Bleeding 
%c[200,200,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]Irradiated 
%c[200,200,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]In combat with enemies 
%c[200,200,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]Under circumstances of an emission or psi-storm 
 
%c[200,50,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]All hardcore save modes are compatible with each other. 
%c[200,50,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]You can add campfire saving to this mode in your playthrough at any time. 
See "Options" -> "Game" -> "Campfire saving"

%c[0,150,150,150]An addition feature for Ironman mode that allows you to set how many lives you have at the beginning of your new game. 
 
Everytime you die, you will lose a life. 
Once you run out of lives, all the game saves of your related playthrough will be removed. 
 
%c[200,200,50,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]Ironman mode must be active.

%c[0,150,150,150]An addition feature for Ironman mode that allows you to set how many days it will take to grant an extra life. 
 
%c[200,200,50,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]Sleeping will not help. 
%c[200,200,50,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]Ironman mode must be active.

%c[0,150,150,150]In Timer mode, you can save your game every specific amount of time. 
Once you save your game, you cannot make another save once again until the timer is over. 
 
%c[200,50,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]All hardcore save modes are compatible with each other.

%c[0,150,150,150]Extended population is a mode that makes life in the Zone more active and unpredictable. 
 
Mutants will guard their territories during the day, and at night they will gather and attack the camps of stalkers. Stalkers will begin to explore the Zone and collect resources for themselves and their faction. Factions are trying to strengthen their region and capture the neighboring one. 
 
%c[200,50,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]Compatible with all modes. 
%c[200,50,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]You can change population activity in your playthrough at any time. 
See "Options" -> "Game". Then "Population squades activity". 
%c[200,50,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]Some characters that don't take part in the 'Mysteries of the Zone' storyline may die. To enable their respawn 
See "Options" -> "Game". Then "Unique NPC respawn". 
 
%c[0,255,255,255]Recommended for: advanced players who are familiar with Story mode or have played without it.
